abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Business
            Environment Reform and Institutional Strengthening Project
            for Albania is to assist the Government to: (i) facilitate
            business entry and operations in the formal economy; and
            (ii) strengthen the enterprise sector's capability to
            increase exports towards the region and European Union (EU)
            markets. The following changes are: (i) extending the
            closing date from January 15, 2012 to June 30, 2012 to
            complete the remaining activities, major ones of which
            include the construction of the metrology laboratory and
            procurement of equipment for it; (ii) addition of a new
            activity under activity one of Part A (Facilitation of
            Business Entry and Operations) in line with the project
            objectives to establish an institutional and legal framework
            for inspections reform and to advance the inspection reform
            launched; (ii) substituting the Administrative and
            Regulatory Cost Survey (ARCS) with small surveys to measure
            outcomes under activity one of Part A and removing this as a
            dated covenant; (iii) dropping formally assistance to a
            Competition Policy Unit (CPU) under activity two of Part A
            as it was de facto dropped during the negotiations; and (iv)
            reallocating savings from consultants services and goods
            categories, as well as the unallocated amount to works
            category for the contract for construction of the metrology building.
